image.altText: A bearded older man wears an oxygen tube, holds a broken tile and a tile cutter next to a bonding glue in a room

props.synopsis: Under the careful tutelage of Albert "Doc" Todd, patients at a South Australian palliative care service are turning plain tables into colourful pieces of art.

title.children: Hospital art project helps 'leave a glow', palliative care patient says

image.altText: Old, rusty, red ute on the right hand side. Red dirt and clear blue sky.

props.synopsis: In the remote town of Andamooka, even native plants struggle to survive. Scientists are trying to find a solution to food security, a problem shared by outback residents and future space travellers.

title.children: Outback SA is likened to Mars. Would it be easier to grow plants there?

image.altText: Protesters at a March for Australia rally in Townsville.

props.synopsis: Clashes break out at some of the anti-immigration rallies being held across the country, including in Melbourne, where police have used pepper spray.

title.children: Scuffles at anti-immigration rallies held across the country

image.altText: The March for Australia rally in Adelaide.

props.synopsis: Members of the multicultural community describe fear and hurt after the weekend's anti-immigration demonstrations, while experts raise concerns about far-right groups.

title.children: Experts say weekend anti-immigration rallies raise 'concerning development'

image.altText: Ben Griscti of the Adelaide 36ers warms up by shooting the basketball

props.synopsis: Adelaide 36ers player Ben Griscti has been injured during a training session after a backboard collapsed on top of him.

title.children: NBL player injured when backboard collapses on him following dunk

image.altText: A man in a cap and jacket stands in front of black stud inside a barn

props.synopsis: Farmers have turned out in droves to compete at South Australia's largest agricultural event after a challenging year facing drought conditions.

title.children: Families and farmers flock to SA's largest carnival and agricultural show

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man diving from a height in front of people watching and boathouses on a river

props.synopsis: The small Victorian town of Nelson has endured tough times over the past five years, but now a small group of friends plans to revive an event that attracted huge crowds up until the 1970s.

title.children: Can this historic regatta coax tourists back to struggling river town?

image.altText: A tree with its branches down on the ground at Henley Beach

props.synopsis: Destructive winds sweeping across South Australia have damaged roofs, fences and caused power outages, with the BOM recording two "likely" tornadoes in Adelaide's northern suburbs.

title.children: Two small and fast-moving tornadoes 'likely' hit Adelaide's northern suburbs

image.altText: a young woman leans against a wall staring at the camera with a somber expression

props.synopsis: From poorly categorised NDIS support to high rates of suicide, Tourette syndrome advocates say it's the last disability where "it's still acceptable for people to laugh at".

title.children: 'Loudest in the room ... yet still invisible': Tourette syndrome advocates plead for change

image.altText: An aerial image of sheep and a tractor in a dusty paddock.

props.synopsis: The federal government announces an additional $1 billion for farm drought loans and commits to continuing the scheme beyond 2026.

title.children: Drought assistance extended with $1b for Victorian, SA farmers

image.altText: Matthew Draganoff in front of a Union Jack flag

props.synopsis: The brother of a man murdered by his landlord in 2021 has told the man responsible he had taken "the heart and soul of a family" and could not "unsee" the harrowing footage of the victim's final moments.

title.children: 'How could you possibly do this to our family?' Impact statements read to landlord who murdered man

image.altText: A man in a blue shirt and hat in a bus filled with glassware cabinets.

props.synopsis: At 33, house painter Jeff Morgan broke his hand and suffered a strange injury that unravelled his life. It was at the kitchen table, where his children were painting with watercolours, that he found his calling.

title.children: House painter turned 'kaleidoscope bus' artist finds his calling

image.altText: A white woman wearing a white top and blue jeans raises her hands and sings on stage

props.synopsis: A remote kids choir and a large outback music festival are keen to continue their partnership after successful performances in far west New South Wales.

title.children: Outback students singing at Mundi Mundi Bash a 'heart-melting' moment

image.altText: Three men and two women sitting at a long white desk

props.synopsis: Two energy companies that were set to benefit from a more than $5 billion desalination plant and water pipeline have pulled out, prompting questions over the project's final cost and feasibility.

title.children: Private backers exit from SA’s $5 billion Northern Water project

image.altText: A stone building with large columns

props.synopsis: A disability carer who killed her client in a crash south of Adelaide when she "lost control" and mistakenly hit the accelerator instead of a brake has been spared an immediate jail term.

title.children: Disability carer sentenced for killing client in 'terrible accident'

image.altText: A man in a suit walks out of a court building with glass doors

props.synopsis: Political experts, politicians and the public say a by-election should be held in the state seat of Mount Gambier ahead of the South Australian state election in seven months to make sure the city is represented in parliament.

title.children: Guilty South Australian MP's exit set to spark by-election

image.altText: FILE PHOTO: Republican presidential nominee and former U.S. President Donald Trump holds a campaign rally in Novi, Michigan

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's declaration that, "I have the right to do anything I want", didn't get the attention it deserved.

title.children: This authoritarian Trump statement didn't get the attention it deserves

image.altText: An iPhone screen

props.synopsis: The study, which will inform the government's impending social media ban for under-16s, found several methods were viable, but no method was foolproof, with concerns over both accuracy and privacy.

title.children: Social media age verification possible but laden with risks, study warns

image.altText: A masked man wearing military combat camouflage gear.

props.synopsis: Since the war began, Abu Obeida had issued dozens of televised speeches, always appearing in military fatigues and a red keffiyeh scarf to obscure his face, and published audio messages, press releases and social media posts.

title.children: Hamas chief spokesperson killed in strikes, Israel says

image.altText: Federal MP Bob Katter

props.synopsis: If the parliament does not take action — even symbolically — against Bob Katter's threats to punch a journalist, the perception of double standards will be hard to avoid.

title.children: The response to Katter's outburst will test parliament this week

image.altText: Aerial shot of suburban streets of housing

props.synopsis: Australian property prices have been pushed higher again in August as lower interest rates, rising real wages and buyer optimism collided with a shortage of homes for sale.

title.children: House prices rising in 'seller's market' as new listings below average

image.altText: Oscar Piastri on the podium, holding the winner's trophy and smiling

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri has won the Formula 1 Dutch Grand Prix from pole, while his championship rival Lando Norris failed to finish.

title.children: Piastri wins and takes big lead in F1 title race as Norris goes up in smoke

image.altText: Celestino and Michelle hold a photo of Jasmine on her wedding day.

props.synopsis: A new report paints a picture of a system that has failed to deliver fast and fair access to treatment for people with rare and less common cancers.

title.children: Celestino's daughter died from rare cancer. Days later, his own returned

image.altText: Machete found strapped to chest of man arrested in Wagga Wagga

props.synopsis: A ban on machetes in Victoria has come into effect. It follows a series of criminal incidents in which the weapons were used.

title.children: Victorian ban on owning machetes comes into force today

image.altText: Roslyn Grima sits on a bench, with bush behind her.

props.synopsis: Residents at a seaside caravan park in northern Tasmania own their own homes, but the park is no longer allowing sales due to council rules that say the land is not approved for residential use.

title.children: 'It can't be moved': Caravan park resident told she can't sell her home

image.altText: A line of people look at their mobile phones.

props.synopsis: Two-thirds of teenagers get their health advice on social media, but a researcher says much of it is a "waste of time and money" and at worst, potentially harmful.

title.children: Teens warned misinformation about health is 'rife' on social media

image.altText: A person in a black hoodie throws an item towards a wall of police holding shields.

props.synopsis: The Indonesian president's announcement comes after days of protests across the country.

title.children: Indonesia's president to revoke some politicians' privileges after protests

image.altText: A man standing behind a woman with his hands on her shoulders.

props.synopsis: They were Australia's premiere small screen couple but away from the set of A Country Practice, Anne Tenney and Shane Withington were keeping a secret and rubbing shoulders with one of the planet's biggest musical stars.

title.children: Molly's on-screen death shook the nation, now its stars are finally talking about it

image.altText: A man in a black Tshirt sitting in front of a computer game and smiling at the camera.

props.synopsis: Rob Taylor has motor neuron disease and uses specially-designed controllers to play video games with his son Chris.

title.children: People with disability finding connections in accessible video games

image.altText: Volodymyr Zelenskyy holding his hand up as he talks at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says more strikes "deep" within Russia are on the cards after a series of drone attacks against Ukraine's power grid.

title.children: Ukraine threatens retaliation after Russian strikes on power grid

image.altText: A montage of an old two-storey stone mansion, a rolls-royce car, a sheep and a boy wearing a VR eyemask.

props.synopsis: The drought in western Victoria is forcing sheep farmers to the wall, but amid the dirt and dust are green shoots of optimism and ingenuity that will change farming here forever.

title.children: Farmers innovate to beat drought in former 'wool capital of the world'

image.altText: Nic Naitanui, Matt Priddis, Dean Cox, Mitchell Brown and Scott Lycett stand arm in arm singing West Coast Eagles' AFL team song.

props.synopsis: Mitch Brown will forever be etched in the game's history, but experts, advocacy groups and fans pushing for systematic change say this is not a time for celebration.

title.children: 'Homophobia permeates every square centimetre' of the AFL

image.altText: Lady holding a wallet with 20 dollar bills.

props.synopsis: Lou Gibson saved more than she expected last year by taking part in the No Spend September challenge.

title.children: Pay cash, cancel subscriptions — ways to get involved in No Spend September

image.altText: Jimmy Li with the Chinese peace statue.

props.synopsis: Though hailed as a "beautiful call for peace", this 60kg bronze statue of a young girl has languished in a suburban garage for nearly a year.

title.children: 'Silent, unspeakable humiliation': Australia's first Chinese comfort woman statue

image.altText: A Queensland Ambulance Vehicle driving fast.

props.synopsis: Queensland paramedics say a girl was taken to a Townsville hospital after being bitten by a snake.

title.children: Teenage girl taken to hospital in life-threatening condition after snake bite
